solution.text:
Let the money Rakshit had be x.
Then the money Raunak had = x + _{i}_.
Money left with Rakshit, when he spent _{k}_ rupees for lunch = x - _{k}_
similarly
Money left with Raunak, when he spent _{j}_ rupees for lunch = x + _{i}_ - _{j}_ = x + _{{i-j}}_
Therefore,
Their product =\((x - _{k}_)\times (x + _{{i-j}}_)\)
i.e.,= \(x^2 -_{k}_x + _{{i-j}}_x - _{{k*(i-j)}}_\)
i.e.,= \(x^2 +_{{-k+i-j}}_x - _{{k*(i-j)}}_\)
Given that product = _{l}_
So,
i.e., \(x^2 +_{{-k+i-j}}_x - _{{k*(i-j)}}_\) = _{l}_
i.e., \(x^2 +_{{-k+i-j}}_x - _{{(k*(i-j))+l}}_\) = 0

content.text: Raunak had _{i}_ rupees more than Rakshit. If Raunak spent _{j}_ rupees and Rakshit spent _{k}_ rupees for lunch.Then the product of the money they had after lunch is _{l}_ rupees.Represent this situation in the form of quadratic equation.
